item.title: Regional Threat Intelligence Aggregator
item.description:
Project Status: [Active Development]

The Problem

Global threat feeds (AlienVault, VirusTotal) are noisy. A generic “high severity” alert for a US bank is irrelevant noise for a local infrastructure in Georgia. This noise leads to alert fatigue in the SOC.

The Solution

A custom Python middleware that ingests public feeds, filters them against a “Relevance Dictionary” (local IPs, regional keywords, sector-specific targeting), and pushes high-fidelity IoCs to our internal SIEM.
item.content:
Project Status: [Active Development]

The Problem

Global threat feeds (AlienVault, VirusTotal) are noisy. A generic “high severity” alert for a US bank is irrelevant noise for a local infrastructure in Georgia. This noise leads to alert fatigue in the SOC.

The Solution

A custom Python middleware that ingests public feeds, filters them against a “Relevance Dictionary” (local IPs, regional keywords, sector-specific targeting), and pushes high-fidelity IoCs to our internal SIEM.

Tech Stack

  • Ingestion: Python 3 (Requests, Pandas for data normalization).
  • Storage: Elasticsearch (ELK Stack).
  • Visualization: Kibana Dashboard for “Threats by Sector” and “Active Campaigns.”

Current Modules

  1. Feed Collector: Pulls from 5+ open-source lists.
  2. Geo-Filter: Discards IoCs not relevant to the Caucasus region or specific sectors.
  3. Wazuh Integration: Automatically updates the Wazuh blocklist with high-confidence IPs.
